thread.title: Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds fly south on UK tour
thread.title_full: Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds fly south on UK tour

title: Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds fly south on UK tour
text:
0 comments 
NOEL Gallagher’s High Flying Birds have announced they will tour UK arenas next year, ending their dates with a Bournemouth International Centre date. 
2015 has seen the band complete a worldwide tour that included a sell-out UK arena tour in March, along with headlining major summer festivals including T In The Park and Latitude, all to huge critical acclaim. 
While Super Furry Animals will join them on all their other tour dates, the special guests for their South Coast date, on April 30, are still to be announced. 
New single The Dying Of The Light is taken from the album Chasing Yesterday and will be released on December 11. To celebrate the release of this fifth single from the award winning album, Noel Gallagher’s High Flying Birds will play a one-off show at London’s Royal Albert Hall the day before. 
Chasing Yesterday went straight to No.1 in the Official UK Album Chart after its March 2nd release – and remains the highest selling album in its first week on sale in 2015. 
Noel Gallagher’s High Flying Birds were honoured with the reader voted Q Award for Best Album earlier this week, adding to Noel’s long list of accolades including the Ivor Novello Award for Outstanding Song Collection in 2013, the NME Godlike Genius Award in 2012 and the Q Icon Award. Share article 
Tickets for the arena tour go on sale on Friday at 9am. 
Box office: 0844 576 3000 or bhlivetickets.co.uk Promoted Stories Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds fly south on UK tour Sorry, an error occurred.
